meta_info.name: OBSERVATION
meta_info.description: Entry subtype for all clinical data in the past or present, i.e. which (by the time it is recorded) has already occurred. `OBSERVATION` data is expressed using the class `HISTORY<T>`, which guarantees that it is situated in time. `OBSERVATION` is used for all notionally objective (i.e. measured in some way) observations of phenomena, and patient-reported phenomena, e.g. pain.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The data of this observation, in the form of a history of values which may be of any complexity.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Optional recording of the state of subject of this observation during the observation process, in the form of a separate history of values which may be of any complexity. State may also be recorded within the History of the data attribute.
